lines.text:
[about the boys]
They may be underprivileged, but they sure ain't underdeveloped.
With all those boys here it should be about as quiet as the funhouse at Coney Island.
How can you read in the dark?
What'd you say?
I said how can you read in the dark?
I went to night school.

[the tobacco jar's moving]
Now look Mr. tobacco jar, I don't smoke, I'm not bothering you, so you don't bother me, okay?

[looking at a trunk]
You gonna open it?
Maybe it's one of those "Don't open 'til Christmas".
Where we going?
We're going to camp!
Camp? How do you like that? I thought we were going to reform school, I would've been a sophomore this year.
No kidding!
Yeah!
I milked a cow once, you know it's got four faucets to it.
What for?
Well the first faucet's for buttermilk, the second's for bottled milk, and the third's for evaporated milk.
What's the fourth one for?
Come to think of it, this cow only had three faucets.
I don't like that guy's altitude, if he thinks I'm staying out here associating with the pigs and cows, he's crazy.
I got an idea, when it's dark...
We make a break for it?
Exactly.
I'm going alone.
That makes three of us going alone.
